Question
========

One tests H~1~: p = 0.4 against H~2~: p = 0.6 in a random sample of n = 11 observations. Testing quantity is the binomially distributed stochast B, the number of successes in the sample. As the right critical limit, the value 5 is used. The discernment power 1 - Î² is then equal to

----------

* 0.67
* 0.74
* 0.77

Solution
========

Answerlist
